messages: 2a3da254cb49167bf82b3a66068abe61 (20:45): mbrubeck: sorry for the late reply. Did you get no response in #it ? I'd imagine this is a fairly high-prio issue...
2a3da254cb49167bf82b3a66068abe61 (20:45): (but, like anyone, I could be wrong!)
51c1edab440268cdb0754ff0c4584a9f (20:46): 2a3da254cb49167bf82b3a66068abe61: you mean build.m.o cert?

51c1edab440268cdb0754ff0c4584a9f (20:46): 2a3da254cb49167bf82b3a66068abe61: I CC'ed release@m.o and someone will notice soonish, that its a weekend compounds the issue -- especially since there are plans in place for many teams to work this weekend, but very very focused
51c1edab440268cdb0754ff0c4584a9f (20:47): 2a3da254cb49167bf82b3a66068abe61: if that is it: Bug 722061

2a3da254cb49167bf82b3a66068abe61 (20:58): 51c1edab440268cdb0754ff0c4584a9f: yes. OK, if people are on it, that works. But you're confirming to me it's high prio, in which case maybe severity > normal is warranted. :)
2a3da254cb49167bf82b3a66068abe61 (20:58): has been trying to find the magic list of how IT interprets severity (ie pagers, phones ringing etc.) but has been unsuccessful

51c1edab440268cdb0754ff0c4584a9f (20:59): 8eb5a47634f626b142d2a93e9baf009f: happen to have a few brief moments? I feel we may need to sync re: the very brief e-mail convo, I just want to make sure we're both looking at that with the same (Firefox-side) thoughts in mind

51c1edab440268cdb0754ff0c4584a9f (20:59): 2a3da254cb49167bf82b3a66068abe61: I'm not sure if people are actually working on it, just know theres a bug on file... I don't pretend to understand (at this time) what the right prio is there, but if you feel it needs to be high, feel free to set a severity a bit higher, but say why when you do :-)
2a3da254cb49167bf82b3a66068abe61 (21:00): 51c1edab440268cdb0754ff0c4584a9f: I'm not involved, so I'm not the right person to tickle that bug. ;)
51c1edab440268cdb0754ff0c4584a9f (21:00): 8eb5a47634f626b142d2a93e9baf009f: I have a suspicion the overall point of me e-mailing you on it was lost, but thats what I want to chat about -- basically.
2a3da254cb49167bf82b3a66068abe61 (21:00): would still like to find IT's magic list
2a3da254cb49167bf82b3a66068abe61 (21:01): I have a feeling it was a blogpost by justdave sometime or something, but google has so far not helped me find it back.
9139b5bbff3c9c6a37be5d2af014270f (21:02): 2a3da254cb49167bf82b3a66068abe61: "normal" = "it should get to it within the next week", according to https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/form:itrequest
050421e96671fe1a3d8cf2b5dbe99cb7 (21:03): 2a3da254cb49167bf82b3a66068abe61: https://blog.mozilla.com/it/2011/09/26/working-with-it-bug-submissions/
050421e96671fe1a3d8cf2b5dbe99cb7 (21:05): but normal is fine, people aren't dying from having to accept an expired cert to retrigger builds
050421e96671fe1a3d8cf2b5dbe99cb7 (21:06): tbpl's ui for letting you know what the problem is could conceivably be a little better, though...
050421e96671fe1a3d8cf2b5dbe99cb7 (21:06): "(network error)"
2a3da254cb49167bf82b3a66068abe61 (21:07): Does tbpl do client-side requests to build.m.o for that stuff? If so, it might not get any better info...
050421e96671fe1a3d8cf2b5dbe99cb7 (21:07): it does, and I wondered whether or not it was possible to do better
050421e96671fe1a3d8cf2b5dbe99cb7 (21:07): since one of the possibilities catlee raised first thing this morning was using the self-signed cert
2a3da254cb49167bf82b3a66068abe61 (21:09): Hmm, so it does, but in fact it looks like it's requesting build.m.o over http rather than https?
2a3da254cb49167bf82b3a66068abe61 (21:09): might not have used the right requests...
2a3da254cb49167bf82b3a66068abe61 (21:09): Anyway, my experience with jQuery (which it uses) is that you get an error callback which says 'error', and very little else.

050421e96671fe1a3d8cf2b5dbe99cb7 (21:10): GET https://build.mozilla.org/buildapi/self-serve/mozilla-inbound/rev/2c215e31b7d0?format=json, POST https://build.mozilla.org/buildapi/self-serve/mozilla-inbound/build
2a3da254cb49167bf82b3a66068abe61 (21:11): wonders if we're looking at the same page.
2a3da254cb49167bf82b3a66068abe61 (21:11): I just see it looking for builds-running / builds-pending.
050421e96671fe1a3d8cf2b5dbe99cb7 (21:12): oh, them, I'm retriggering
2a3da254cb49167bf82b3a66068abe61 (21:12): You actually *need* auth + ssl for that, I suppose?
050421e96671fe1a3d8cf2b5dbe99cb7 (21:13): yeah, pretty sure buildapi redirects you if you don't hit ssl
050421e96671fe1a3d8cf2b5dbe99cb7 (21:13): indeed
2a3da254cb49167bf82b3a66068abe61 (21:14): The easiest (general way around that I can quickly think of would be proxying through tbpl itself and overriding the cert warning there.
2a3da254cb49167bf82b3a66068abe61 (21:15): What was the idea with the self-signed cert?

050421e96671fe1a3d8cf2b5dbe99cb7 (21:17): like https://secure.pub.build.mozilla.org/ - it would be faster than updating a real cert, with the slight disadvantage that it wouldn't really do any good :)
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (21:20): 00adb0702a98d60e91bee853adc4a0af, *really* done with bugspam? :)
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (21:21): bholley, 8 non-xpc includes... Of which two are in DOMClassinfo :)
51c1edab440268cdb0754ff0c4584a9f (21:32): 8eb5a47634f626b142d2a93e9baf009f: I'll take the no reply here as "I don't have time" please ping me if you notice this and have time later.
8eb5a47634f626b142d2a93e9baf009f (21:52): 51c1edab440268cdb0754ff0c4584a9f: wasn't following this channel closely. What's up?
5c00c96ec811bdcfbf010d89ed9779bc (21:52): When I try to find the correct arguments to pass to a function i don't understand, it feels like i'm filling out a government form

51c1edab440268cdb0754ff0c4584a9f (21:53): 8eb5a47634f626b142d2a93e9baf009f: do you have a few minutes to discuss the e-mail exchange we had, I have a gut feeling based on your reply that the main point I was trying to express was missed (and/or that we may not have a shared understanding of the overall issue [with Firefox in mind of course])
51c1edab440268cdb0754ff0c4584a9f (21:53): 8eb5a47634f626b142d2a93e9baf009f: just want to be sure we are on the same page there

51c1edab440268cdb0754ff0c4584a9f (21:54): 8eb5a47634f626b142d2a93e9baf009f: it is not urgent, and we can defer even a week or two if need be, just figured it best to discuss while its in both our minds.
8eb5a47634f626b142d2a93e9baf009f (21:58): 51c1edab440268cdb0754ff0c4584a9f: sure. tell me more.
5c00c96ec811bdcfbf010d89ed9779bc (22:02): 8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81: trying to figure how to call xpc_qsXPCOMObjectToJsval in CustomQS_Canvas2D.h
5c00c96ec811bdcfbf010d89ed9779bc (22:02): there is already a use of it in that file, but it seems very intricate
5c00c96ec811bdcfbf010d89ed9779bc (22:02): i dont know what qsObjectHelper to pass it
5c00c96ec811bdcfbf010d89ed9779bc (22:03): rather, i dont know what 'interface' object to pass to qsObjectHelper. Should I just create a new ImageData and cast?
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (22:05): It seems to me that the xpc_qsGetWrapperCache users in that file are just broken
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (22:06): Or peterv, but I guess that's even less likely
5c00c96ec811bdcfbf010d89ed9779bc (22:07): notes that xpc_qsXPCOMObjectToJsval has 4 different acronyms in its name
db4527b32e976e105e549db55c39a21b (22:07): s/To/2/ and you'd have five
db4527b32e976e105e549db55c39a21b (22:08): hell, make it xpc_qsXPCOMObj2Jsval
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (22:08): // This is one of the slowest things quick stubs do.
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (22:08): XPConnect, always inspiring confidence
db4527b32e976e105e549db55c39a21b (22:08): how many people know about the js-ctypes getRuntime backdoor
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (22:10): 5c00c96ec811bdcfbf010d89ed9779bc, looks like qsObjectHelper helper(imageData, NULL); should work
bbd8a1c8b716f90cfaf9493cbb3868dc (22:10): wtf, firefox can't connect to anything, but safari can
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (22:11): But can you watch porn with it?
bbd8a1c8b716f90cfaf9493cbb3868dc (22:11): i have a bunch of tabs trying to load bug reports from bugzilla
bbd8a1c8b716f90cfaf9493cbb3868dc (22:11): and one tab trying to load something, but its url bar shows about:blank, so i'm scared to stop it or use session restore
bbd8a1c8b716f90cfaf9493cbb3868dc (22:12): and reload doesn't do anything at all in the tabs that do have the URL they're trying to load in the url bar
bbd8a1c8b716f90cfaf9493cbb3868dc (22:12): aaaargh
5c00c96ec811bdcfbf010d89ed9779bc (22:13): 8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81: thanks. here, imageData is a new ImageData I just construct? and keep alive with a ref to it?
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (22:14): Note that if you pass a nsCOMPtr to qsObjectHelper, it will be null afterwards
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (22:15): files a bug for the other users
bbd8a1c8b716f90cfaf9493cbb3868dc (22:15): ok, at least session restore didn't completely fuck that up
db4527b32e976e105e549db55c39a21b (22:25): "Keys equality is not based on the same algorithm than the one used in the === operator."
db4527b32e976e105e549db55c39a21b (22:25): what does that mean?
db4527b32e976e105e549db55c39a21b (22:25): maybe s/than/as/ is appropriate
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (22:27): db4527b32e976e105e549db55c39a21b, where'd you get that from?
db4527b32e976e105e549db55c39a21b (22:28): https://developer.mozilla.org/en/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Map
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (22:30): db4527b32e976e105e549db55c39a21b, I assume it uses the 'is' operator, then
db4527b32e976e105e549db55c39a21b (22:30): trying to decide if I should use that yet or not
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (22:31): Do it and provide feedback :)
db4527b32e976e105e549db55c39a21b (22:31): I need to update my trunk fist
